ayas.arabic: الٓمٓ
ayas.translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
ayas.transliteration: alif lām mīm

bismillah.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

ayas.arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ
ayas.translation: Allah—there is no god except Him—is the Living One, the All-sustainer.
ayas.transliteration: allāhu lā ilāha illā huwal ḥayyul qayyūm

ayas.arabic: نَزَّلَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ وَٱلْإِنجِيلَ
ayas.translation: He has sent down to you the Book with the truth, confirming what was [revealed] before it, and He had sent down the Torah and the Evangel
ayas.transliteration: nazzala `alaykal kitāba bil ḥaqqi muṣaddiqal limā bayna yadayhi wa-anzalat tawrāta wal-injīl

ayas.arabic: مِن قَبْلُ هُدًى لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَنزَلَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ ذُو ٱنتِقَامٍ
ayas.translation: before as guidance for mankind, and He has sent down the Criterion. Indeed, there is a severe punishment for those who deny the signs of Allah, and Allah is all-mighty, avenger.
ayas.transliteration: min qablu hudan linnāsi wa-anzalal-furqān ۗ innal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyātillāhi lahum `adhābun shadīd ۗ wallāhu `azīzun dhun-tiqām

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَيْهِ شَىْءٌ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
ayas.translation: Nothing is indeed hidden from Allah in the earth or in the sky.
ayas.transliteration: innallāha lā yakhfā `alayhi shay-un fil-arḍi walā fis samā-i

ayas.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُصَوِّرُكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْحَامِ كَيْفَ يَشَآءُ ۚ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayas.translation: It is He who forms you in the wombs [of your mothers] however He wishes. There is no god except Him, the All-mighty, the All-wise.
ayas.transliteration: huwal ladhī yuṣawwirukum fil-arḥāmi kayfa yashā-u ۚ lā ilāha illā huwal `azīzul ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ مِنْهُ ءَايَـٰتٌ مُّحْكَمَـٰتٌ هُنَّ أُمُّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَأُخَرُ مُتَشَـٰبِهَـٰتٌ ۖ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمْ زَيْغٌ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ مَا تَشَـٰبَهَ مِنْهُ ٱبْتِغَآءَ ٱلْفِتْنَةِ وَٱبْتِغَآءَ تَأْوِيلِهِۦ ۗ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ تَأْوِيلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَٱلرَّٰسِخُونَ فِى ٱلْعِلْمِ يَقُولُونَ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ كُلٌّ مِّنْ عِندِ رَبِّنَا ۗ وَمَا يَذَّكَّرُ إِلَّآ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
ayas.translation: It is He who has sent down to you the Book. Parts of it are definitive verses, which are the mother of the Book, while others are metaphorical. As for those in whose hearts is deviance, they pursue what is metaphorical in it, courting temptation, and seeking its interpretation. But no one knows its interpretation except Allah and those firmly grounded in knowledge; they say, ‘We believe in it; all of it is from our Lord.’ And none takes admonition except those who possess intellect.
ayas.transliteration: huwal ladhī anzala `alaykal kitāba minhu āyātun muḥkamātun hunna ummul kitābi wa-ukharu mutashābihāt ۖ fa-ammal ladhīna fī qulūbihim zayghun fayattabi`ūna mā tashābaha minhub-tighā-al fitnati wabtighā-a ta-wīlih ۗ wa mā ya`lamu ta-wīlahu illallāh ۗ war rāsikhūna fil `il-mi yaqūlūna āmannā bihi kullun min `indi rabbinā ۗ wa mā yadhhakkaru illā ulul-albāb

ayas.arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
ayas.translation: [They say,] ‘Our Lord! Do not make our hearts swerve after You have guided us, and bestow Your mercy on us. Indeed, You are the All-munificent.
ayas.transliteration: rabbanā lā tuzigh qulūbanā ba`da idh hadaytanā wahab lanā min ladunka raḥmah ۚ innaka antal wahhāb

ayas.arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
ayas.translation: Our Lord! You will indeed gather mankind on a day in which there is no doubt. Indeed Allah does not break His promise.’
ayas.transliteration: rabbanā innaka jāmi`un nāsi liyawmin lā rayba fīh ۚ innallāha lā yukhliful mī`ād

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَن تُغْنِىَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَٰلُهُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ وَقُودُ ٱلنَّارِ
ayas.translation: As for the faithless, neither their wealth nor their children shall avail them anything against Allah; it is they who will be fuel for the Fire;
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū lan tughniya `anhum amwāluhum walā awlāduhum minallāhi shay-ā ۖ wa-ulā-ika hum waqūdun nār

ayas.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
ayas.translation: as in the case of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who denied Our signs. So Allah seized them for their sins, and Allah is severe in retribution.
ayas.transliteration: kada-bi āli fir`awna wal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ kadhhabū bi-āyātinā fa-akhadhahumullāhu bidhunūbihim ۗ wallāhu shadīdul `iqāb

ayas.arabic: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَتُغْلَبُونَ وَتُحْشَرُونَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
ayas.translation: Say to the faithless, ‘You shall be overcome and mustered toward hell, and it is an evil resting place.’
ayas.transliteration: qul lilladhīna kafarū satughlabūna watuḥsharūna ilā jahannam ۚ wabi-sal mihād

ayas.arabic: قَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ ءَايَةٌ فِى فِئَتَيْنِ ٱلْتَقَتَا ۖ فِئَةٌ تُقَـٰتِلُ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَأُخْرَىٰ كَافِرَةٌ يَرَوْنَهُم مِّثْلَيْهِمْ رَأْىَ ٱلْعَيْنِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُؤَيِّدُ بِنَصْرِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرِ
ayas.translation: There was certainly a sign for you in the two hosts that met: one host fighting in the way of Allah and the other faithless, who saw them as visibly twice as many. Allah strengthens whomever He wishes with His help. There is indeed a moral in that for those who have insight.
ayas.transliteration: qad kāna lakum āyatun fī fi-ataynil taqatā ۖ fi-atun tuqātilu fī sabīlillāhi wa-ukhrā kāfiratun yarawnahum mithlayhim ra-yal `ayn ۚ wallāhu yu-ayyidu binaṣrihi man yashā-u ۗ inna fī dhālika la`ibratan li-ulil-abṣār

ayas.arabic: زُيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ حُبُّ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِ مِنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ وَٱلْبَنِينَ وَٱلْقَنَـٰطِيرِ ٱلْمُقَنطَرَةِ مِنَ ٱلذَّهَبِ وَٱلْفِضَّةِ وَٱلْخَيْلِ ٱلْمُسَوَّمَةِ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ وَٱلْحَرْثِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ مَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ عِندَهُۥ حُسْنُ ٱلْمَـَٔابِ
ayas.translation: The love of [worldly] allures, including women and children, accumulated piles of gold and silver, horses of mark, livestock, and farms has been made to seem decorous to mankind. Those are the wares of the life of this world, but the goodness of one’s ultimate destination lies near Allah.
ayas.transliteration: zuyyina linnāsi ḥubbush shahawāti minan nisā-i wal banīna wal qanāṭīril muqanṭarati minadh dhahabi wal fiḍḍati wal khaylil musawwamati wal-an`āmi wal ḥarth ۗ dhālika matā`ul ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wallāhu `indahu ḥusnul ma-āb

ayas.arabic: قُلْ أَؤُنَبِّئُكُم بِخَيْرٍ مِّن ذَٰلِكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا وَأَزْوَٰجٌ مُّطَهَّرَةٌ وَرِضْوَٰنٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘Shall I inform you of something better than that? For those who are Godwary there will be gardens near their Lord, with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever], and chaste mates, and Allah’s pleasure.’ And Allah watches His servants.
ayas.transliteration: qul a-unabbi-ukum bikhayrin min dhālikum ۚ lilladhīnat-taqaw `inda rabbihim jannātun tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā wa-azwājun muṭahharatun wariḍwānun minallāh ۗ wallāhu baṣīrun bil `ibād

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
ayas.translation: Those who say, ‘Our Lord! Indeed, we have faith. So forgive us our sins, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.’
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā innanā āmannā faghfir lanā dhunūbanā waqinā `adhāban nār

ayas.arabic: ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ وَٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ وَٱلْقَـٰنِتِينَ وَٱلْمُنفِقِينَ وَٱلْمُسْتَغْفِرِينَ بِٱلْأَسْحَارِ
ayas.translation: [They are] patient and truthful, obedient and charitable, and they plead for [Allah’s] forgiveness at dawns.
ayas.transliteration: aṣ-ṣābirīna waṣ ṣādiqīna wal qānitīna wal munfiqīna wal mustaghfirīna bil-as-ḥār

ayas.arabic: شَهِدَ ٱللَّهُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمِ قَآئِمًۢا بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۚ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayas.translation: Allah, maintainer of justice, the Almighty and the All-wise, besides whom there is no god, bears witness that there is no god except Him, and [so do] the angels and those who possess knowledge.
ayas.transliteration: shahidallāhu annahu lā ilāha illā huwa wal malā-ikatu wa-ulul `il-mi qā-iman bil qisṭ ۚ lā ilāha illā huwal `azīzul ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمُ ۗ وَمَا ٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعِلْمُ بَغْيًۢا بَيْنَهُمْ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
ayas.translation: Indeed, with Allah religion is Islam, and those who were given the Book did not differ except after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves. And whoever denies Allah’s signs [should know that] Allah is swift at reckoning.
ayas.transliteration: innad dīna `indallāhil-islām ۗ wa makh-talafal ladhīna ūtul kitāba illā min ba`di mā jā-ahumul `il-mu baghyan baynahum ۗ wa man yakfur bi-āyātillāhi fa-innallāha sarī`ul ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: فَإِنْ حَآجُّوكَ فَقُلْ أَسْلَمْتُ وَجْهِىَ لِلَّهِ وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَنِ ۗ وَقُل لِّلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ ءَأَسْلَمْتُمْ ۚ فَإِنْ أَسْلَمُوا۟ فَقَدِ ٱهْتَدَوا۟ ۖ وَّإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
ayas.translation: If they argue with you, say, ‘I have submitted my will to Allah, and [so has] he who follows me.’ And say to those who were given the Book and the uninstructed ones, ‘Do you submit?’ If they submit, they will certainly be guided; but if they turn away, then your duty is only to communicate, and Allah watches His servants.
ayas.transliteration: fa-in ḥājjūka faqul aslamtu wajhiya lillāhi wa manit-taba`an ۗ waqul lilladhīna ūtul kitāba wal-ummiyyīna a-aslamtum ۚ fa-in aslamū faqadih-tadaw ۖ wa in tawallaw fa-innamā `alaykal balāgh ۗ wallāhu baṣīrun bil `ibād

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Those who deny Allah’s signs and kill the prophets unjustly and kill those who call for justice from among the people, inform them of a painful punishment.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wayaqtulūnan nabiyyīna bighayri ḥaqqin wayaqtulūnal ladhīna ya-murūna bil qisṭi minan nāsi fabashhirhum bi`adhābin alīm

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
ayas.translation: They are the ones whose works have failed in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna ḥabiṭat a`māluhum fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

ayas.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ نَصِيبًا مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ كِتَـٰبِ ٱللَّهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُمْ وَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
ayas.translation: Have you not regarded those who were given a share of the Book, who are summoned to the Book of Allah in order that it may judge between them, whereat a part of them refuse to comply and they are disregardful?
ayas.transliteration: alam tara ilal ladhīna ūtū naṣīban minal kitābi yud`awna ilā kitābillāhi liyaḥkuma baynahum thumma yatawallā farīqun minhum wahum mu`riḍūn

ayas.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامًا مَّعْدُودَٰتٍ ۖ وَغَرَّهُمْ فِى دِينِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
ayas.translation: That is because they say, ‘The Fire shall not touch us except for a number of days,’ and they have been misled in their religion by what they used to fabricate.
ayas.transliteration: dhālika bi-annahum qālū lan tamassanan nāru illā ayyāman ma`dūdāt ۖ wagharrahum fī dīnihim mā kānū yaftarūn

ayas.arabic: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَوُفِّيَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: But how will it be [with them] when We gather them on a day in which there is no doubt, and every soul shall be recompensed fully for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged?
ayas.transliteration: fakayfa idhā jama`nāhum liyawmin lā rayba fīhi wawuffiyat kullu nafsin mā kasabat wahum lā yuẓlamūn

ayas.arabic: قُلِ ٱللَّهُمَّ مَـٰلِكَ ٱلْمُلْكِ تُؤْتِى ٱلْمُلْكَ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتَنزِعُ ٱلْمُلْكَ مِمَّن تَشَآءُ وَتُعِزُّ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتُذِلُّ مَن تَشَآءُ ۖ بِيَدِكَ ٱلْخَيْرُ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘O Allah, Master of all sovereignty! You give sovereignty to whomever You wish, and strip of sovereignty whomever You wish; You make mighty whomever You wish, and You degrade whomever You wish; all choice is in Your hand. Indeed You have power over all things.’
ayas.transliteration: qulillāhumma mālikal mulki tu-til mulka man tashā-u watanzi`ul mulka mimman tashā-u watu`izzu man tashā-u watudhillu man tashā-u ۖ biyadikal khayr ۖ innaka `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

ayas.arabic: تُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَتُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ ۖ وَتُخْرِجُ ٱلْحَىَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَيِّتِ وَتُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلْحَىِّ ۖ وَتَرْزُقُ مَن تَشَآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
ayas.translation: ‘You make the night pass into the day and You make the day pass into the night. You bring forth the living from the dead and You bring forth the dead from the living, and You provide for whomever You wish without any reckoning.’
ayas.transliteration: tūlijul layla fin nahāri watūlijun nahāra fil layl ۖ watukhrijul ḥayya minal mayyiti watukhrijul mayyita minal ḥayy ۖ watarzuqu man tashā-u bighayri ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: لَّا يَتَّخِذِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ فِى شَىْءٍ إِلَّآ أَن تَتَّقُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ تُقَىٰةً ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسَهُۥ ۗ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayas.translation: The faithful should not take the faithless for allies instead of the faithful, and Allah will have nothing to do with those who do that, except when you are wary of them, out of caution. Allah warns you to beware of [disobeying] Him, and toward Allah is the return.
ayas.transliteration: lā yattakhidhil mu-minūnal kāfirīna awliyā-a min dūnil mu-minīn ۖ wa man yaf`al dhālika falaysa minallāhi fī shay-in illā an tattaqū minhum tuqah ۗ wayuḥadhhirukumullāhu nafsah ۗ wa ilallāhil maṣīr

ayas.arabic: قُلْ إِن تُخْفُوا۟ مَا فِى صُدُورِكُمْ أَوْ تُبْدُوهُ يَعْلَمْهُ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘Whether you hide what is in your hearts or disclose it, Allah knows it, and He knows whatever there is in the heavens and whatever there is in the earth; and Allah has power over all things.’
ayas.transliteration: qul in tukhfū mā fī ṣudūrikum aw tubdūhu ya`lamhullāh ۗ waya`lamu mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۗ wallāhu `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ تَجِدُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا عَمِلَتْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ مُّحْضَرًا وَمَا عَمِلَتْ مِن سُوٓءٍ تَوَدُّ لَوْ أَنَّ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَهُۥٓ أَمَدًۢا بَعِيدًا ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسَهُۥ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ رَءُوفٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
ayas.translation: The day when every soul will find present whatever good it has done; and as for the evil, it has done, it will wish there were a far distance between it and itself. Allah warns you to beware of [disobeying] Him, and Allah is most kind to [His] servants.
ayas.transliteration: yawma tajidu kullu nafsin mā `amilat min khayrin muḥḍaran wa mā `amilat min sū-in tawaddu law anna baynahā wabaynahu amadan ba`īdā ۗ wayuḥadhhirukumullāhu nafsah ۗ wallāhu ra-ūfun bil `ibād

ayas.arabic: قُلْ إِن كُنتُمْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱللَّهَ فَٱتَّبِعُونِى يُحْبِبْكُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘If you love Allah, then follow me; Allah will love you and forgive you your sins, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
ayas.transliteration: qul in kuntum tuḥibbūnallāha fattabi`ūnī yuḥbibkumullāhu wayaghfir lakum dhunūbakum ۗ wallāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

ayas.arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘Obey Allah and the Apostle.’ But if they turn away, indeed Allah does not like the faithless.
ayas.transliteration: qul aṭī`ullāha war rasūl ۖ fa-in tawallaw fa-innallāha lā yuḥibbul kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ءَادَمَ وَنُوحًا وَءَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَءَالَ عِمْرَٰنَ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed Allah chose Adam and Noah, and the progeny of Abraham and the progeny of Imran above all the nations;
ayas.transliteration: innallāhaṣ-ṭafā ādama wanūḥan wa-āla ibrāhīma wa-āla `imrāna `alal-`ālamīn

ayas.arabic: ذُرِّيَّةًۢ بَعْضُهَا مِنۢ بَعْضٍ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: some of them are descendants of the others, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
ayas.transliteration: dhurriyyatan ba`ḍuhā min ba`ḍ ۗ wallāhu samī`un `alīm

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ عِمْرَٰنَ رَبِّ إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لَكَ مَا فِى بَطْنِى مُحَرَّرًا فَتَقَبَّلْ مِنِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
ayas.translation: When the wife of Imran said, ‘My Lord, I dedicate to You in consecration what is in my belly. Accept it from me; indeed You are the All-hearing, the All-knowing.’
ayas.transliteration: idh qālatim-ra-atu `imrāna rabbi innī nadhartu laka mā fī baṭnī muḥarraran fataqabbal minnī ۖ innaka antas samī`ul `alīm

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا وَضَعَتْهَا قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّى وَضَعْتُهَآ أُنثَىٰ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا وَضَعَتْ وَلَيْسَ ٱلذَّكَرُ كَٱلْأُنثَىٰ ۖ وَإِنِّى سَمَّيْتُهَا مَرْيَمَ وَإِنِّىٓ أُعِيذُهَا بِكَ وَذُرِّيَّتَهَا مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ
ayas.translation: When she bore her, she said, ‘My Lord, I have borne a female [child]’—and Allah knew better what she had borne, and the male [child she expected] was no match for the female [child she had borne] —‘and I have named her Mary, and I commend her and her offspring to Your care against [the evil of] the outcast Satan.’
ayas.transliteration: falammā waḍa`at-hā qālat rabbi innī waḍa`tuhā unthā wallāhu a`lamu bimā waḍa`at walaysadh dhakaru kal-unthā ۖ wa innī sammaytuhā maryama wa innī u`īdhuhā bika wadhurriyyatahā minash shayṭānir rajīm

ayas.arabic: فَتَقَبَّلَهَا رَبُّهَا بِقَبُولٍ حَسَنٍ وَأَنۢبَتَهَا نَبَاتًا حَسَنًا وَكَفَّلَهَا زَكَرِيَّا ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَ عَلَيْهَا زَكَرِيَّا ٱلْمِحْرَابَ وَجَدَ عِندَهَا رِزْقًا ۖ قَالَ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ أَنَّىٰ لَكِ هَـٰذَا ۖ قَالَتْ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
ayas.translation: Thereupon her Lord accepted her with a gracious acceptance, and made her grow up in a worthy fashion, and He charged Zechariah with her care. Whenever Zechariah visited her in the sanctuary, he would find provisions with her. He said, ‘O Mary, from where does this come for you?’ She said, ‘It comes from Allah. Allah provides whomever He wishes without any reckoning.’
ayas.transliteration: fataqabbalahā rabbuhā biqabūlin ḥasanin wa-anbatahā nabātan ḥasanan wakaffalahā zakariyyā ۖ kullamā dakhala `alayhā zakariyyal miḥrāba wajada `indahā rizqā ۖ qāla yāmaryamu annā laki hādhā ۖ qālat huwa min `indillāh ۖ innallāha yarzuqu man yashā-u bighayri ḥisāb

ayas.arabic: هُنَالِكَ دَعَا زَكَرِيَّا رَبَّهُۥ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ هَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ ٱلدُّعَآءِ
ayas.translation: Thereat Zechariah supplicated his Lord. He said, ‘My Lord! Grant me a good offspring from You! Indeed You hear all supplications.’
ayas.transliteration: hunālika da`ā zakariyyā rabbah ۖ qāla rabbi hab lī min ladunka dhurriyyatan ṭayyibah ۖ innaka samī`ud du`ā-i

ayas.arabic: فَنَادَتْهُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَآئِمٌ يُصَلِّى فِى ٱلْمِحْرَابِ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحْيَىٰ مُصَدِّقًۢا بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَسَيِّدًا وَحَصُورًا وَنَبِيًّا مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
ayas.translation: Then, as he stood praying in the sanctuary the angels called out to him: ‘Allah gives you the good news of John, as a confirmer of a Word of Allah, eminent and chaste, a prophet, and one of the righteous.’
ayas.transliteration: fanādat-hul malā-ikatu wahuwa qā-imun yuṣallī fil miḥrābi annallāha yubashhiruka biyaḥyā muṣaddiqan bikalimatim minallāhi wasayyidan waḥaṣūran wanabiyyan minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌ وَقَدْ بَلَغَنِىَ ٱلْكِبَرُ وَٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱللَّهُ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَشَآءُ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘My Lord, how shall I have a son while old age has overtaken me and my wife is barren?’ Said He, ‘So it is that Allah does whatever He wishes.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla rabbi annā yakūnu lī ghulāmun waqad balaghaniyal kibaru wamra-atī `āqir ۖ qāla kadhālikallāhu yaf`alu mā yashā-u

ayas.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةً ۖ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَـٰثَةَ أَيَّامٍ إِلَّا رَمْزًا ۗ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ كَثِيرًا وَسَبِّحْ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِبْكَـٰرِ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘My Lord, grant me a sign.’ Said He, ‘Your sign is that you will not speak to people for three days except in gestures. Remember Your Lord much, and glorify Him morning and evening.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla rabbij-`al lī āyah ۖ qāla āyatuka allā tukalliman nāsa thalāthata ayyāmin illā ramzā ۗ wadhkur rabbaka kathīran wasabbiḥ bil `ashiyyi wal-ibkār

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَتِ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَٱصْطَفَىٰكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَآءِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: And when the angels said, ‘O Mary, Allah has chosen you and purified you, and He has chosen you above the world’s women.
ayas.transliteration: wa idh qālatil malā-ikatu yāmaryamu innallāhaṣ-ṭafāki waṭahharaki waṣṭafāki `alā nisā-il `ālamīn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰمَرْيَمُ ٱقْنُتِى لِرَبِّكِ وَٱسْجُدِى وَٱرْكَعِى مَعَ ٱلرَّٰكِعِينَ
ayas.translation: O Mary, be obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow down with those who bow [in worship].’
ayas.transliteration: yāmaryamuq-nutī lirabbiki wasjudī warka`ī ma`ar rāki`īn

ayas.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يُلْقُونَ أَقْلَـٰمَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ يَكْفُلُ مَرْيَمَ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
ayas.translation: These accounts are from the Unseen, which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they were casting lots [to see] which of them would take charge of Mary’s care, nor were you with them when they were contending.
ayas.transliteration: dhālika min anbā-il ghaybi nūḥīhi ilayk ۚ wa mā kunta ladayhim idh yulqūna aqlāmahum ayyuhum yakfulu maryama wa mā kunta ladayhim idh yakhtaṣimūn

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكِ بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنْهُ ٱسْمُهُ ٱلْمَسِيحُ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ وَجِيهًا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
ayas.translation: When the angels said, ‘O Mary, Allah gives you the good news of a Word from Him whose name is Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, distinguished in the world and the Hereafter and one of those brought near [to Allah].
ayas.transliteration: idh qālatil malā-ikatu yāmaryamu innallāha yubashhiruki bikalimatim minhus muhul masīḥu `īsab-nu maryama wajīhan fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa minal muqarrabīn

ayas.arabic: وَيُكَلِّمُ ٱلنَّاسَ فِى ٱلْمَهْدِ وَكَهْلًا وَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
ayas.translation: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in adulthood, and will be one of the righteous.’
ayas.transliteration: wayukallimun nāsa fil mahdi wakahlan wa minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَتْ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى وَلَدٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ ٱللَّهُ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
ayas.translation: She said, ‘My Lord, how shall I have a child seeing that no human has ever touched me?’ He said, ‘So it is that Allah creates whatever He wishes. When He decides on a matter He just says to it ‘‘Be!’’ and it is.
ayas.transliteration: qālat rabbi annā yakūnu lī waladun walam yamsasnī bashar ۖ qāla kadhālikillāhu yakhluqu mā yashā-u ۚ idhā qaḍā amran fa-innamā yaqūlu lahu kun fayakūn

ayas.arabic: وَيُعَلِّمُهُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ وَٱلْإِنجِيلَ
ayas.translation: He will teach him the Book and wisdom, the Torah and the Evangel,
ayas.transliteration: wayu`allimuhul kitāba wal ḥikmata wat tawrāta wal-injīl

ayas.arabic: وَرَسُولًا إِلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَنِّى قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ أَنِّىٓ أَخْلُقُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطِّينِ كَهَيْـَٔةِ ٱلطَّيْرِ فَأَنفُخُ فِيهِ فَيَكُونُ طَيْرًۢا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُبْرِئُ ٱلْأَكْمَهَ وَٱلْأَبْرَصَ وَأُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا تَأْكُلُونَ وَمَا تَدَّخِرُونَ فِى بُيُوتِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: and [he will be] an apostle to the Children of Israel, [and he will declare,] “I have certainly brought you a sign from your Lord: I will create for you the form of a bird out of clay, then I will breathe into it, and it will become a bird by Allah’s leave. I heal the blind and the leper and I revive the dead by Allah’s leave. I will tell you what you have eaten and what you have stored in your houses. There is indeed a sign in that for you, should you be faithful.
ayas.transliteration: warasūlan ilā banī isrā-iyla annī qad ji-tukum bi-āyatim min rabbikum ۖ annī akhluqu lakum minaṭ ṭīni kahay-atiṭ ṭayri fa-anfukhu fīhi fayakūnu ṭayran bi-idhnillāh ۖ wa-ubri-ul-akmaha wal-abraṣa wa-uḥyil mawtā bi-idhnillāh ۖ wa-unabbi-ukum bimā ta-kulūna wa mā taddakhirūna fī buyūtikum ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan lakum in kuntum mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: وَمُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَىَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَلِأُحِلَّ لَكُم بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى حُرِّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَجِئْتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
ayas.translation: And [I come] to confirm [the truth of] that which is before me of the Torah, and to make lawful for you some of the things that were forbidden you. I have brought you a sign from your Lord; so be wary of Allah and obey me.
ayas.transliteration: wa muṣaddiqal limā bayna yadayya minat tawrāti wali-uḥilla lakum ba`ḍal ladhī ḥurrima `alaykum ۚ waji-tukum bi-āyatim min rabbikum fattaqullāha wa-aṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۗ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
ayas.translation: Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him. This is a straight path.” ’
ayas.transliteration: innallāha rabbī warabbukum fa`budūh ۗ hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīm

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَحَسَّ عِيسَىٰ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْكُفْرَ قَالَ مَنْ أَنصَارِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ ٱلْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنصَارُ ٱللَّهِ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَٱشْهَدْ بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: When Jesus sensed their faithlessness, he said, ‘Who will be my helpers [on the path] toward Allah?’ The Disciples said, ‘We will be helpers of Allah. We have faith in Allah, and you be witness that we have submitted [to Him].
ayas.transliteration: falammā aḥassa `īsā minhumul kufra qāla man anṣārī ilallāh ۖ qālal-ḥawāriyyūna naḥnu anṣārullāhi āmannā billāhi wash-had bi-annā muslimūn

ayas.arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا بِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ وَٱتَّبَعْنَا ٱلرَّسُولَ فَٱكْتُبْنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
ayas.translation: Our Lord, we believe in what You have sent down, and we follow the apostle, so write us among the witnesses.’
ayas.transliteration: rabbanā āmannā bimā anzalta wattaba`nar rasūla faktubnā ma`ash shāhidīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ وَمَكَرَ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلْمَـٰكِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Then they plotted [against Jesus], and Allah also devised, and Allah is the best of devisers.
ayas.transliteration: wa makarū wa makarallāh ۖ wallāhu khayrul mākirīn

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَـٰعِيسَىٰٓ إِنِّى مُتَوَفِّيكَ وَرَافِعُكَ إِلَىَّ وَمُطَهِّرُكَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَجَاعِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوكَ فَوْقَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ فِيمَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
ayas.translation: When Allah said, ‘O Jesus, I shall take you[r soul], and I shall raise you up toward Myself, and I shall clear you of [the calumnies of] the faithless, and I shall set those who follow you above the faithless until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me will be your return, whereat I will judge between you concerning that about which you used to differ.
ayas.transliteration: idh qālallāhu yā`īsā innī mutawaffīka warāfi`uka ilayya wa muṭahhiruka minal ladhīna kafarū wajā`ilul ladhīnat-taba`ūka fawqal ladhīna kafarū ilā yawmil qiyāmah ۖ thumma ilayya marji`ukum fa-aḥkumu baynakum fīmā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

ayas.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَأُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
ayas.translation: As for the faithless, I will punish them with a severe punishment in the world and the Hereafter; and they will have no helpers.’
ayas.transliteration: fa-ammal ladhīna kafarū fa-u`adhhibuhum `adhāban shadīdan fid dunyā wal-ākhirati wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَيُوَفِّيهِمْ أُجُورَهُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: But as for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, He will pay them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti fayuwaffīhim ujūrahum ۗ wallāhu lā yuḥibbuẓ ẓālimīn

ayas.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ نَتْلُوهُ عَلَيْكَ مِنَ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ وَٱلذِّكْرِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
ayas.translation: These that We recite to you are from the signs and the Wise Reminder.
ayas.transliteration: dhālika natlūhu `alayka minal-āyāti wadh dhikril ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ مَثَلَ عِيسَىٰ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ كَمَثَلِ ءَادَمَ ۖ خَلَقَهُۥ مِن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
ayas.translation: Indeed the case of Jesus with Allah is like the case of Adam: He created him from dust, then said to him, ‘Be,’ and he was.
ayas.transliteration: inna mathala `īsā `indallāhi kamathali ādam ۖ khalaqahu min turābin thumma qāla lahu kun fayakūn

ayas.arabic: ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
ayas.translation: This is the truth from your Lord, so do not be among the skeptics.
ayas.transliteration: al-ḥaqqu min rabbika falā takun minal mumtarīn

ayas.arabic: فَمَنْ حَآجَّكَ فِيهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ فَقُلْ تَعَالَوْا۟ نَدْعُ أَبْنَآءَنَا وَأَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَنِسَآءَنَا وَنِسَآءَكُمْ وَأَنفُسَنَا وَأَنفُسَكُمْ ثُمَّ نَبْتَهِلْ فَنَجْعَل لَّعْنَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
ayas.translation: Should anyone argue with you concerning him, after the knowledge that has come to you, say, ‘Come! Let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, our souls and your souls, then let us pray earnestly, and call down Allah’s curse upon the liars.’
ayas.transliteration: faman ḥājjaka fīhi min ba`di mā jā-aka minal `il-mi faqul ta`ālaw nad`u abnā-anā wa-abnā-akum wanisā-anā wanisā-akum wa-anfusanā wa-anfusakum thumma nabtahil fanaj`al la`natallāhi `alal-kādhibīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْقَصَصُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۚ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayas.translation: This is indeed the true account, for sure. There is no god but Allah, and indeed Allah is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
ayas.transliteration: inna hādhā lahuwal qaṣaṣul ḥaqq ۚ wa mā min ilāhin illallāh ۚ wa innallāha lahuwal `azīzul ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
ayas.translation: But if they turn away, indeed Allah knows best the agents of corruption.
ayas.transliteration: fa-in tawallaw fa-innallāha `alīmun bil mufsidīn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ تَعَالَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ كَلِمَةٍ سَوَآءٍۭ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمْ أَلَّا نَعْبُدَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ وَلَا نُشْرِكَ بِهِۦ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُنَا بَعْضًا أَرْبَابًا مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُولُوا۟ ٱشْهَدُوا۟ بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘O People of the Book! Come to a common word between us and you: that we will worship no one but Allah, that we will not ascribe any partner to Him, and that some of us will not take some others as lords besides Allah.’ But if they turn away, say, ‘Be witnesses that we have submitted [to Allah].’
ayas.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi ta`ālaw ilā kalimatin sawā-in baynanā wabaynakum allā na`buda illallāha walā nushrika bihi shay-an walā yattakhidha ba`ḍunā ba`ḍan arbāban min dūnillāh ۚ fa-in tawallaw faqūlush-hadū bi-annā muslimūn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تُحَآجُّونَ فِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَمَآ أُنزِلَتِ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةُ وَٱلْإِنجِيلُ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
ayas.translation: O People of the Book! Why do you argue concerning Abraham? Neither the Torah nor the Evangel were sent down until [long] after him. Do you not exercise your reason?
ayas.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima tuḥājjūna fī ibrāhīma wa mā unzilatit tawrātu wal-injīlu illā min ba`dih ۚ afalā ta`qilūn

ayas.arabic: هَـٰٓأَنتُمْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ حَـٰجَجْتُمْ فِيمَا لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ فَلِمَ تُحَآجُّونَ فِيمَا لَيْسَ لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Ah! You are the very ones who argue about that of which you have knowledge. But why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows and you do not know.
ayas.transliteration: hā-antum hā-ulā-i ḥājajtum fīmā lakum bihi `il-mun falima tuḥājjūna fīmā laysa lakum bihi `il-m ۚ wallāhu ya`lamu wa-antum lā ta`lamūn

ayas.arabic: مَا كَانَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ يَهُودِيًّا وَلَا نَصْرَانِيًّا وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ حَنِيفًا مُّسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
ayas.translation: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian. Rather, he was a Hanif, a Muslim, and he was not one of the polytheists.
ayas.transliteration: mā kāna ibrāhīmu yahūdiyyan walā naṣrāniyyan walākin kāna ḥanīfan musliman wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ أَوْلَى ٱلنَّاسِ بِإِبْرَٰهِيمَ لَلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوهُ وَهَـٰذَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَلِىُّ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed the nearest of all people to Abraham are those who follow him and this prophet and those who have faith, and Allah is the guardian of the faithful.
ayas.transliteration: inna awlan nāsi bi-ibrāhīma lalladhīnat-taba`ūhu wahādhan nabiyyu wal ladhīna āmanū ۗ wallāhu waliyyul mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: وَدَّت طَّآئِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَوْ يُضِلُّونَكُمْ وَمَا يُضِلُّونَ إِلَّآ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
ayas.translation: A group of the People of the Book were eager to lead you astray; yet they lead no one astray except themselves, but they are not aware.
ayas.transliteration: waddat ṭā-ifatun min ahlil kitābi law yuḍillūnakum wa mā yuḍillūna illā anfusahum wa mā yash`urūn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَنتُمْ تَشْهَدُونَ
ayas.translation: O People of the Book! Why do you deny Allah’s signs while you testify [to their truth]?
ayas.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima takfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wa-antum tash-hadūn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَلْبِسُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَتَكْتُمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: O People of the Book! Why do you mix the truth with falsehood, and conceal the truth while you know [it]?
ayas.transliteration: yā-ahlal-kitābi lima talbisūnal ḥaqqa bil bāṭili wataktumūnal ḥaqqa wa-antum ta`lamūn

ayas.arabic: وَقَالَت طَّآئِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَجْهَ ٱلنَّهَارِ وَٱكْفُرُوٓا۟ ءَاخِرَهُۥ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
ayas.translation: A group of the People of the Book say, ‘Believe in what has been sent down to the faithful at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve at its end, so that they may turn back [from their religion].’
ayas.transliteration: waqālat ṭā-ifatun min ahlil kitābi āminū bil ladhī unzila `alal ladhīna āmanū wajhan nahāri wakfurū ākhirahu la`allahum yarji`ūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِمَن تَبِعَ دِينَكُمْ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْهُدَىٰ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ أَن يُؤْتَىٰٓ أَحَدٌ مِّثْلَ مَآ أُوتِيتُمْ أَوْ يُحَآجُّوكُمْ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْفَضْلَ بِيَدِ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: And [they say,] ‘Do not believe anyone except him who follows your religion.’ Say, ‘Indeed [true] guidance is the guidance of Allah.’ [They also say.] ‘[Do not believe] that anyone may be given the like of what you were given, or that he may argue with you before your Lord.’ Say, ‘Indeed all grace is in Allah’s hand; He grants it to whomever He wishes, and Allah is all-bounteous, all-knowing.
ayas.transliteration: walā tu-minū illā liman tabi`a dīnakum qul innal hudā hudallāhi an yu-tā aḥadun mithla mā ūtītum aw yuḥājjūkum `inda rabbikum ۗ qul innal faḍla biyadillāhi yu-tīhi man yashā-u ۗ wallāhu wāsi`un `alīm

ayas.arabic: يَخْتَصُّ بِرَحْمَتِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayas.translation: He singles out for His mercy whomever He wishes, and Allah is dispenser of a great grace.’
ayas.transliteration: yakhtaṣṣu biraḥmatihi man yashā-u ۗ wallāhu dhul faḍlil `aẓīm

ayas.arabic: وَمِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِقِنطَارٍ يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيْكَ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِدِينَارٍ لَّا يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيْكَ إِلَّا مَا دُمْتَ عَلَيْهِ قَآئِمًا ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لَيْسَ عَلَيْنَا فِى ٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ سَبِيلٌ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Among the People of the Book is he who if you entrust him with a quintal will repay it to you, and among them is he who, if you entrust him with a dinar will not repay it to you unless you stand persistently over him. That is because they say, ‘We have no obligation to the non-Jews.’ But they attribute lies to Allah, and they know [it].
ayas.transliteration: wa min ahlil kitābi man in ta-manhu biqinṭāriy yu-addihi ilayka wa minhum man in ta-manhu bidīnārin lā yu-addihi ilayka illā mā dumta `alayhi qā-imā ۗ dhālika bi-annahum qālū laysa `alaynā fil-ummiyyīna sabīlun wayaqūlūna `alallāhil kadhiba wahum ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: بَلَىٰ مَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِعَهْدِهِۦ وَٱتَّقَىٰ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
ayas.translation: Yes, whoever fulfills his commitments and is wary of Allah—Allah indeed loves the Godwary.
ayas.transliteration: balā man awfā bi`ahdihi wattaqā fa-innallāha yuḥibbul muttaqīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَشْتَرُونَ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَا خَلَـٰقَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَلَا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَا يَنظُرُ إِلَيْهِمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَلَا يُزَكِّيهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: There shall be no share in the Hereafter for those who sell Allah’s covenant and their oaths for a paltry gain, and on the Day of Resurrection Allah will not speak to them nor will He [so much as] look at them, nor will He purify them, and there is a painful punishment for them.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna yashtarūna bi`ahdillāhi wa-aymānihim thamanan qalīlan ulā-ika lā khalāqa lahum fil-ākhirati walā yukallimuhumullāhu walā yanẓuru ilayhim yawmal qiyāmati walā yuzakkīhim walahum `adhābun alīm

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّ مِنْهُمْ لَفَرِيقًا يَلْوُۥنَ أَلْسِنَتَهُم بِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِتَحْسَبُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَيَقُولُونَ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: There is a group of them who alter their voice while reading out a text [that they have themselves authored], so that you may suppose it to be from the Book, though it is not from the Book, and they say, ‘It is from Allah,’ though it is not from Allah, and they attribute lies to Allah, and they know [it].
ayas.transliteration: wa inna minhum lafarīqan yalwūna alsinatahum bil kitābi litaḥsabūhu minal kitābi wa mā huwa minal kitābi wayaqūlūna huwa min `indillāhi wa mā huwa min `indillāhi wayaqūlūna `alallāhil kadhiba wahum ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُؤْتِيَهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحُكْمَ وَٱلنُّبُوَّةَ ثُمَّ يَقُولَ لِلنَّاسِ كُونُوا۟ عِبَادًا لِّى مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِن كُونُوا۟ رَبَّـٰنِيِّـۧنَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تُعَلِّمُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَبِمَا كُنتُمْ تَدْرُسُونَ
ayas.translation: It does not behoove any human that Allah should give him the Book, judgement and prophethood, and then he should say to the people, ‘Be my servants instead of Allah.’ Rather [he would say], ‘Be a godly people, because of your teaching the Book and because of your studying it.’
ayas.transliteration: mā kāna libasharin an yu-tiyahullāhul kitāba wal ḥukma wan nubuwwata thumma yaqūla linnāsi kūnū `ibādal lī min dūnillāhi walākin kūnū rabbāniyyīna bimā kuntum tu`allimūnal kitāba wabimā kuntum tadrusūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا يَأْمُرَكُمْ أَن تَتَّخِذُوا۟ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ وَٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ أَرْبَابًا ۗ أَيَأْمُرُكُم بِٱلْكُفْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: And he would not command you to take the angels and the prophets for lords. Would he call you to unfaith after you have submitted [to Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: walā ya-murakum an tattakhidhul malā-ikata wan nabiyyīna arbābā ۗ aya-murukum bil kufri ba`da idh antum muslimūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِيثَـٰقَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ لَمَآ ءَاتَيْتُكُم مِّن كِتَـٰبٍ وَحِكْمَةٍ ثُمَّ جَآءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ مُّصَدِّقٌ لِّمَا مَعَكُمْ لَتُؤْمِنُنَّ بِهِۦ وَلَتَنصُرُنَّهُۥ ۚ قَالَ ءَأَقْرَرْتُمْ وَأَخَذْتُمْ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُمْ إِصْرِى ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَقْرَرْنَا ۚ قَالَ فَٱشْهَدُوا۟ وَأَنَا۠ مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
ayas.translation: When Allah took a compact concerning the prophets, [He said,] ‘Inasmuch as I have given you [the knowledge] of the Book and wisdom, should an apostle come to you thereafter confirming what is with you, you shall believe in him and help him.’ He said, ‘Do you pledge and accept My covenant on this condition?’ They said, ‘We pledge.’ He said, ‘Then be witnesses, and I, too, am among the witnesses along with you.’
ayas.transliteration: wa idh akhadhallāhu mīthāqan nabiyyīna lamā ātaytukum min kitābin waḥikmatin thumma jā-akum rasūlun muṣaddiqul limā ma`akum latu-minunna bihi walatanṣurunnah ۚ qāla a-aqrartum wa-akhadhtum `alā dhālikum iṣrī ۖ qālū aqrarnā ۚ qāla fash-hadū wa-ana ma`akum minash shāhidīn

ayas.arabic: فَمَن تَوَلَّىٰ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
ayas.translation: Then whoever turns away after that—it is they who are the transgressors.
ayas.transliteration: faman tawallā ba`da dhālika fa-ulā-ika humul fāsiqūn

ayas.arabic: أَفَغَيْرَ دِينِ ٱللَّهِ يَبْغُونَ وَلَهُۥٓ أَسْلَمَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَإِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ
ayas.translation: Do they seek a religion other than that of Allah, while to Him submits whoever there is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be brought back?
ayas.transliteration: afaghayra dīnillāhi yabghūna walahu aslama man fis samāwāti wal-arḍi ṭaw`an wakarhan wa ilayhi yurja`ūn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطِ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّنْهُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘We have faith in Allah and in what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, and that which Moses, Jesus and the prophets were given by their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and to Him do we submit.’
ayas.transliteration: qul āmannā billāhi wa mā unzila `alaynā wa mā unzila `alā ibrāhīma wa ismā`īla wa is-ḥāqa waya`qūba wal-asbāṭi wa mā ūtiya mūsā wa`īsā wan nabiyyūna min rabbihim lā nufarriqu bayna aḥadin minhum wanaḥnu lahu muslimūn

ayas.arabic: وَمَن يَبْتَغِ غَيْرَ ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمِ دِينًا فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْهُ وَهُوَ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Should anyone follow a religion other than Islam, it shall never be accepted from him, and he will be among the losers in the Hereafter.
ayas.transliteration: wa man yabtaghi ghayral-islāmi dīnan falan yuqbala minhu wahuwa fil-ākhirati minal khāsirīn

ayas.arabic: كَيْفَ يَهْدِى ٱللَّهُ قَوْمًا كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِهِمْ وَشَهِدُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلرَّسُولَ حَقٌّ وَجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: How shall Allah guide a people who have disbelieved after their faith and [after] bearing witness that the Apostle is true, and [after] manifest proofs had come to them? Allah does not guide the wrongdoing lot.
ayas.transliteration: kayfa yahdillāhu qawman kafarū ba`da-iymānihim washahidū annar rasūla ḥaqqun wajā-ahumul bayyināt ۚ wallāhu lā yahdil qawmaẓ ẓālimīn

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ أَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ لَعْنَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
ayas.translation: Their requital is that there shall be upon them the curse of Allah, the angels, and all mankind.
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ika jazā-uhum anna `alayhim la`natallāhi wal malā-ikati wan nāsi ajma`īn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
ayas.translation: They will remain in it [forever], and their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be granted any respite,
ayas.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā lā yukhaffafu `anhumul `adhābu walā hum yunẓarūn

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
ayas.translation: except such as repent after that and make amends, for Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
ayas.transliteration: illal ladhīna tābū min ba`di dhālika wa-aṣlaḥū fa-innallāha ghafūrun raḥīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِهِمْ ثُمَّ ٱزْدَادُوا۟ كُفْرًا لَّن تُقْبَلَ تَوْبَتُهُمْ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
ayas.translation: Indeed those who turn faithless after their faith, and then advance in faithlessness, their repentance will never be accepted, and it is they who are the astray.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū ba`da-iymānihim thummaz-dādū kufral lan tuqbala tawbatuhum wa-ulā-ika humuḍ ḍāllūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَمَاتُوا۟ وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْ أَحَدِهِم مِّلْءُ ٱلْأَرْضِ ذَهَبًا وَلَوِ ٱفْتَدَىٰ بِهِۦٓ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed those who turn faithless and die while they are faithless, a world of gold will not be accepted from any of them should he offer it for ransom. For such there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū wa mātū wahum kuffārun falan yuqbala min aḥadihim mil-ul-arḍi dhahaban walawif-tadā bih ۗ ulā-ika lahum `adhābun alīmun wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

ayas.arabic: لَن تَنَالُوا۟ ٱلْبِرَّ حَتَّىٰ تُنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا تُحِبُّونَ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِن شَىْءٍ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِهِۦ عَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: You will never attain piety until you spend out of what you hold dear, and whatever you may spend of anything, Allah indeed knows it.
ayas.transliteration: lan tanālul birra ḥattā tunfiqū mimmā tuḥibbūn ۚ wa mā tunfiqū min shay-in fa-innallāha bihi `alīm

ayas.arabic: كُلُّ ٱلطَّعَامِ كَانَ حِلًّا لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ إِلَّا مَا حَرَّمَ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تُنَزَّلَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةُ ۗ قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ فَٱتْلُوهَآ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had forbidden himself before the Torah was sent down. Say, ‘Bring the Torah, and read it, if you are truthful.’
ayas.transliteration: kulluṭ ṭa`āmi kāna ḥillal libanī isrā-iyla illā mā ḥarrama isrā-iylu `alā nafsihi min qabli an tunazzalat tawrāh ۗ qul fa-tū bit tawrāti fatlūhā in kuntum ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: So whoever fabricates a lie against Allah after that—it is they who are the wrongdoers.
ayas.transliteration: famanif-tarā `alallāhil kadhiba min ba`di dhālika fa-ulā-ika humuẓ ẓālimūn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ صَدَقَ ٱللَّهُ ۗ فَٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘Allah has spoken the truth; so follow the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, and he was not one of the polytheists.
ayas.transliteration: qul ṣadaqallāh ۗ fattabi`ū millata ibrāhīma ḥanīfan wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ أَوَّلَ بَيْتٍ وُضِعَ لِلنَّاسِ لَلَّذِى بِبَكَّةَ مُبَارَكًا وَهُدًى لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed the first house to be set up for mankind is the one at Bakkah, blessed and a guidance for all nations.
ayas.transliteration: inna awwala baytin wuḍi`a linnāsi lalladhī bibakkata mubārakan wahudan lil`ālamīn

ayas.arabic: فِيهِ ءَايَـٰتٌۢ بَيِّنَـٰتٌ مَّقَامُ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ۖ وَمَن دَخَلَهُۥ كَانَ ءَامِنًا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ حِجُّ ٱلْبَيْتِ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَاعَ إِلَيْهِ سَبِيلًا ۚ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: In it are manifest signs [and] Abraham’s Station, and whoever enters it shall be secure. And it is the duty of mankind toward Allah to make pilgrimage to the House—for those who can afford the journey to it—and should anyone renege [on his obligation], Allah is indeed without need of the creatures.
ayas.transliteration: fīhi āyātun bayyinātun maqāmu ibrāhīm ۖ wa man dakhalahu kāna āminā ۗ walillāhi `alan nāsi ḥijjul bayti manis-taṭā`a ilayhi sabīlā ۚ wa man kafara fa-innallāha ghaniyyun `anil `ālamīn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘O People of the Book! Why do you deny the signs of Allah, while Allah is witness to what you do?’
ayas.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi lima takfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wallāhu shahīdun `alā mā ta`malūn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لِمَ تَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ تَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَأَنتُمْ شُهَدَآءُ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Say, ‘O People of the Book! why do you bar the faithful from the way of Allah, seeking to make it crooked, while you are witnesses [to its truthfulness]? And Allah is not oblivious of what you do.’
ayas.transliteration: qul yā-ahlal-kitābi lima taṣuddūna `an sabīlillāhi man āmana tabghūnahā `iwajan wa-antum shuhadā-u ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تُطِيعُوا۟ فَرِيقًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَرُدُّوكُم بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِكُمْ كَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: O you who have faith, if you obey a part of those who were given the Book, they will turn you back, after your faith, into faithless ones.
ayas.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū in tuṭī`ū farīqan minal ladhīna ūtul kitāba yaruddūkum ba`da-iymānikum kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ وَأَنتُمْ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ وَفِيكُمْ رَسُولُهُۥ ۗ وَمَن يَعْتَصِم بِٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ هُدِىَ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
ayas.translation: And how would you be faithless while the signs of Allah are recited to you and His Apostle is in your midst? Whoever takes recourse in Allah is certainly guided to a straight path.
ayas.transliteration: wakayfa takfurūna wa-antum tutlā `alaykum āyātullāhi wafīkum rasūluh ۗ wa man ya`taṣim billāhi faqad hudiya ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ حَقَّ تُقَاتِهِۦ وَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: O you who have faith! Be wary of Allah with the wariness due to Him and do not die except as Muslims.
ayas.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanut-taqullāha ḥaqqa tuqātihi walā tamūtunna illā wa-antum muslimūn

ayas.arabic: وَٱعْتَصِمُوا۟ بِحَبْلِ ٱللَّهِ جَمِيعًا وَلَا تَفَرَّقُوا۟ ۚ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ أَعْدَآءً فَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم بِنِعْمَتِهِۦٓ إِخْوَٰنًا وَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰ شَفَا حُفْرَةٍ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ فَأَنقَذَكُم مِّنْهَا ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
ayas.translation: Hold fast, all together, to Allah’s cord, and do not be divided [into sects]. Remember Allah’s blessing upon you when you were enemies, then He brought your hearts together, so you became brothers with His blessing. And you were on the brink of a pit of Fire, whereat He saved you from it. Thus does Allah clarify His signs for you so that you may be guided.
ayas.transliteration: wa`taṣimū biḥablillāhi jamī`an walā tafarraqū ۚ wadhkurū ni`matallāhi `alaykum idh kuntum a`dā-an fa-allafa bayna qulūbikum fa-aṣbaḥtum bini`matihi ikhwānan wakuntum `alā shafā ḥufratim minan nāri fa-anqadhakum minhā ۗ kadhālika yubayyinullāhu lakum āyātihi la`allakum tahtadūn

ayas.arabic: وَلْتَكُن مِّنكُمْ أُمَّةٌ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْخَيْرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ ۚ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
ayas.translation: There has to be a nation among you summoning to the good, bidding what is right, and forbidding what is wrong. It is they who are the felicitous.
ayas.transliteration: waltakun minkum ummatun yad`ūna ilal-khayri waya-murūna bil ma`rūfi wayanhawna `anil munkar ۚ wa-ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ تَفَرَّقُوا۟ وَٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ ۚ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
ayas.translation: Do not be like those who became divided [into sects] and differed after manifest signs had come to them. For such there will be a great punishment
ayas.transliteration: walā takūnū kal ladhīna tafarraqū wakhtalafū min ba`di mā jā-ahumul bayyināt ۚ wa-ulā-ika lahum `adhābun `aẓīm

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ تَبْيَضُّ وُجُوهٌ وَتَسْوَدُّ وُجُوهٌ ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْوَدَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ أَكَفَرْتُم بَعْدَ إِيمَـٰنِكُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
ayas.translation: on the day when [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black [it will be said to them], ‘Did you disbelieve after your faith? So taste the punishment because of what you used to disbelieve.’
ayas.transliteration: yawma tabyaḍḍu wujūhun wataswaddu wujūh ۚ fa-ammal ladhīnas-waddat wujūhuhum akafartum ba`da-iymānikum fadhūqul `adhāba bimā kuntum takfurūn

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ٱبْيَضَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فَفِى رَحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
ayas.translation: But as for those whose faces become white, they shall dwell in Allah’s mercy, and they will remain in it [forever].
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammal ladhīnab-yaḍḍat wujūhuhum fafī raḥmatil lāhi hum fīhā khālidūn

ayas.arabic: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ظُلْمًا لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: These are the signs of Allah, which We recite to you in truth, and Allah does not desire any wrong for the creatures.
ayas.transliteration: tilka āyātullāhi natlūhā `alayka bil ḥaqq ۗ wa mallāhu yurīdu ẓul-mal lil`ālamīn

ayas.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
ayas.translation: To Allah belongs whatever there is in the heavens and the earth, and to Allah all matters are returned.
ayas.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۚ wa ilallāhi turja`ul-umūr

ayas.arabic: كُنتُمْ خَيْرَ أُمَّةٍ أُخْرِجَتْ لِلنَّاسِ تَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَتَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ ۗ وَلَوْ ءَامَنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُم ۚ مِّنْهُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
ayas.translation: You are the best nation [ever] brought forth for mankind: you bid what is right and forbid what is wrong, and have faith in Allah. And if the People of the Book had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them [some] are faithful, but most of them are transgressors.
ayas.transliteration: kuntum khayra ummatin ukhrijat linnāsi ta-murūna bil ma`rūfi watanhawna `anil munkari watu-minūna billāh ۗ walaw āmana ahlul kitābi lakāna khayral lahum ۚ minhumul mu-minūna wa-aktharuhumul fāsiqūn

ayas.arabic: لَن يَضُرُّوكُمْ إِلَّآ أَذًى ۖ وَإِن يُقَـٰتِلُوكُمْ يُوَلُّوكُمُ ٱلْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
ayas.translation: They will never do you any harm, except for some hurt; and if they fight you, they will turn their backs [to flee], then they will not be helped.
ayas.transliteration: lan yaḍurrūkum illā adhā ۖ wa in yuqātilūkum yuwallūkumul-adbāra thumma lā yunṣarūn

ayas.arabic: ضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلذِّلَّةُ أَيْنَ مَا ثُقِفُوٓا۟ إِلَّا بِحَبْلٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَحَبْلٍ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَسْكَنَةُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلْأَنۢبِيَآءَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا۟ وَّكَانُوا۟ يَعْتَدُونَ
ayas.translation: Wherever they are found, abasement is stamped upon them, except for an asylum from Allah and an asylum from the people. They have earned the wrath of Allah, and poverty has been stamped upon them. That, because they would deny the signs of Allah and kill the prophets unjustly. That, because they would disobey and commit transgression.
ayas.transliteration: ḍuribat `alayhimudh dhillatu ayna mā thuqifū illā biḥablin minallāhi waḥablin minan nāsi wabā-ū bighaḍabin minallāhi waḍuribat `alayhimul maskanah ۚ dhālika bi-annahum kānū yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wayaqtulūnal-anbiyā-a bighayri ḥaqq ۚ dhālika bimā `aṣaw wakānū ya`tadūn

ayas.arabic: لَيْسُوا۟ سَوَآءً ۗ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أُمَّةٌ قَآئِمَةٌ يَتْلُونَ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ءَانَآءَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَهُمْ يَسْجُدُونَ
ayas.translation: Yet they are not all alike. Among the People of the Book is an upright nation; they recite Allah’s signs in the watches of the night and prostrate.
ayas.transliteration: laysū sawā-ā ۗ min ahlil kitābi ummatun qā-imatun yatlūna āyātillāhi ānā-al layli wahum yasjudūn

ayas.arabic: يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَيُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
ayas.translation: They have faith in Allah and the Last Day, and bid what is right and forbid what is wrong, and they are active in [performing] good deeds. Those are among the righteous.
ayas.transliteration: yu-minūna billāhi wal yawmil-ākhiri waya-murūna bil ma`rūfi wayanhawna `anil munkari wayusāri`ūna fil khayrāti wa-ulā-ika minaṣ ṣāliḥīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا يَفْعَلُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَلَن يُكْفَرُوهُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
ayas.translation: Whatever good they do, they will not go unappreciated for it, and Allah knows well the Godwary.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā yaf`alū min khayrin falan yukfarūh ۗ wallāhu `alīmun bil muttaqīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَن تُغْنِىَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَٰلُهُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
ayas.translation: As for the faithless, neither their wealth nor their children will avail them anything against Allah. They shall be the inmates of the Fire and remain in it [forever].
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū lan tughniya `anhum amwāluhum walā awlāduhum minallāhi shay-ā ۖ wa-ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۚ hum fīhā khālidūn

ayas.arabic: مَثَلُ مَا يُنفِقُونَ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَثَلِ رِيحٍ فِيهَا صِرٌّ أَصَابَتْ حَرْثَ قَوْمٍ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فَأَهْلَكَتْهُ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَـٰكِنْ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: The parable of what they spend in the life of this world is that of a cold wind that strikes the tillage of a people who wronged themselves, destroying it. Allah does not wrong them, but they wrong themselves.
ayas.transliteration: mathalu mā yunfiqūna fī hādhihil ḥayātid dunyā kamathali rīḥin fīhā ṣirrun aṣābat ḥartha qawmin ẓalamū anfusahum fa-ahlakat-h ۚ wa mā ẓalamahumullāhu walākin anfusahum yaẓlimūn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ بِطَانَةً مِّن دُونِكُمْ لَا يَأْلُونَكُمْ خَبَالًا وَدُّوا۟ مَا عَنِتُّمْ قَدْ بَدَتِ ٱلْبَغْضَآءُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَمَا تُخْفِى صُدُورُهُمْ أَكْبَرُ ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
ayas.translation: O you who have faith! Do not take your confidants from others than yourselves; they will spare nothing to ruin you. They are eager to see you in distress. Hatred has already shown itself from their mouths, and what their breasts hide [within] is yet worse. We have certainly made the signs clear for you, should you exercise your reason.
ayas.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā tattakhidhū biṭānatan min dūnikum lā ya-lūnakum khabālan waddū mā `anittum qad badatil baghḍā-u min afwāhihim wa mā tukhfī ṣudūruhum akbar ۚ qad bayyannā lakumul-āyāt ۖ in kuntum ta`qilūn

ayas.arabic: هَـٰٓأَنتُمْ أُو۟لَآءِ تُحِبُّونَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِبُّونَكُمْ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ كُلِّهِۦ وَإِذَا لَقُوكُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَوْا۟ عَضُّوا۟ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْأَنَامِلَ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ ۚ قُلْ مُوتُوا۟ بِغَيْظِكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
ayas.translation: Ah! You are the ones who bear love towards them, while they do not love you, though you believe in all the Books. When they meet you, they say, ‘We believe,’ but when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you out of rage. Say, ‘Die of your rage!’ Indeed Allah knows well what is in the breasts.
ayas.transliteration: hā-antum ulā-i tuḥibbūnahum walā yuḥibbūnakum watu-minūna bil kitābi kullihi wa idhā laqūkum qālū āmannā wa idhā khalaw `aḍḍū `alaykumul-anāmila minal ghayẓ ۚ qul mūtū bighayẓikum ۗ innallāha `alīmun bidhātiṣ ṣudūr

ayas.arabic: إِن تَمْسَسْكُمْ حَسَنَةٌ تَسُؤْهُمْ وَإِن تُصِبْكُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَفْرَحُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تَصْبِرُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
ayas.translation: If some good should befall you, it upsets them, but if some ill befalls you, they rejoice at it. Yet if you are patient and Godwary, their guile will not harm you in any way. Indeed Allah encompasses what they do.
ayas.transliteration: in tamsaskum ḥasanatun tasu-hum wa in tuṣibkum sayyi-atun yafraḥū bihā ۖ wa in taṣbirū watattaqū lā yaḍurrukum kayduhum shay-ā ۗ innallāha bimā ya`malūna muḥīṭ

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ غَدَوْتَ مِنْ أَهْلِكَ تُبَوِّئُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلْقِتَالِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: When you left your family at dawn to settle the faithful in their positions for battle —and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
ayas.transliteration: wa idh ghadawta min ahlika tubawwi-ul mu-minīna maqā`ida lilqitāl ۗ wallāhu samī`un `alīm

ayas.arabic: إِذْ هَمَّت طَّآئِفَتَانِ مِنكُمْ أَن تَفْشَلَا وَٱللَّهُ وَلِيُّهُمَا ۗ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
ayas.translation: When two groups among you were about to lose courage—though Allah is their guardian, and in Allah let all the faithful put their trust.
ayas.transliteration: idh hammat ṭā-ifatāni minkum an tafshalā wallāhu waliyyuhumā ۗ wa`alallāhi falyatawakkalil mu-minūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَصَرَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِبَدْرٍ وَأَنتُمْ أَذِلَّةٌ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Certainly Allah helped you at Badr, when you were weak [in the enemy’s eyes]. So be wary of Allah so that you may give thanks.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad naṣarakumullāhu bibadrin wa-antum adhillah ۖ fattaqullāha la`allakum tashkurūn

ayas.arabic: إِذْ تَقُولُ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَلَن يَكْفِيَكُمْ أَن يُمِدَّكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِثَلَـٰثَةِ ءَالَـٰفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ مُنزَلِينَ
ayas.translation: When you were saying to the faithful, ‘Is it not enough for you that your Lord should aid you with three thousand angels sent down?’
ayas.transliteration: idh taqūlu lil-mu-minīna alan yakfiyakum an yumiddakum rabbukum bithalāthati ālāfin minal malā-ikati munzalīn

ayas.arabic: بَلَىٰٓ ۚ إِن تَصْبِرُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ وَيَأْتُوكُم مِّن فَوْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا يُمْدِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِخَمْسَةِ ءَالَـٰفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ مُسَوِّمِينَ
ayas.translation: Yes, if you are steadfast and Godwary, and should they come at you suddenly, your Lord will aid you with five thousand angels sent in [to the scene of battle].
ayas.transliteration: balā ۚ in taṣbirū watattaqū waya-tūkum min fawrihim hādhā yumdidkum rabbukum bikhamsati ālāfin minal malā-ikati musawwimīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشْرَىٰ لَكُمْ وَلِتَطْمَئِنَّ قُلُوبُكُم بِهِۦ ۗ وَمَا ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
ayas.translation: Allah did not appoint it but as a good news for you and to reassure with it your hearts; and victory comes only from Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise,
ayas.transliteration: wa mā ja`alahullāhu illā bushrā lakum walitaṭma-inna qulūbukum bih ۗ wa man naṣru illā min `indillāhil `azīzil ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: لِيَقْطَعَ طَرَفًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَوْ يَكْبِتَهُمْ فَيَنقَلِبُوا۟ خَآئِبِينَ
ayas.translation: that He may cut down a section of the faithless, or subdue them, so that they retreat disappointed.
ayas.transliteration: liyaqṭa`a ṭarafan minal ladhīna kafarū aw yakbitahum fayanqalibū khā-ibīn

ayas.arabic: لَيْسَ لَكَ مِنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ شَىْءٌ أَوْ يَتُوبَ عَلَيْهِمْ أَوْ يُعَذِّبَهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: You have no hand in the matter, whether He accepts their repentance or punishes them, for they are indeed wrongdoers.
ayas.transliteration: laysa laka minal-amri shay-un aw yatūba `alayhim aw yu`adhhibahum fa-innahum ẓālimūn

ayas.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
ayas.translation: To Allah belongs whatever there is in the heavens and the earth: He forgives whomever He wishes and punishes whomever He wishes, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
ayas.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍ ۚ yaghfiru liman yashā-u wayu`adhhibu man yashā-u ۚ wallāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَأْكُلُوا۟ ٱلرِّبَوٰٓا۟ أَضْعَـٰفًا مُّضَـٰعَفَةً ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
ayas.translation: O you who have faith! Do not exact usury, twofold and severalfold, and be wary of Allah so that you may be felicitous.
ayas.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā ta-kulur ribā aḍ`āfan muḍā`afah ۖ wattaqullāha la`allakum tufliḥūn

ayas.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Beware of the Fire, which has been prepared for the faithless,
ayas.transliteration: wattaqun nāral latī u`iddat lilkāfirīn

ayas.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
ayas.translation: and obey Allah and the Apostle so that you may be granted [His] mercy.
ayas.transliteration: wa-aṭī`ullāha war rasūla la`allakum turḥamūn

ayas.arabic: وَسَارِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
ayas.translation: Hasten towards your Lord’s forgiveness and a paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the Godwary
ayas.transliteration: wasāri`ū ilā maghfiratim min rabbikum wajannatin `arḍuhas samāwātu wal-arḍu u`iddat lil-muttaqīn

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ فِى ٱلسَّرَّآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ وَٱلْكَـٰظِمِينَ ٱلْغَيْظَ وَٱلْعَافِينَ عَنِ ٱلنَّاسِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
ayas.translation: —those who spend in ease and adversity, and suppress their anger, and excuse [the faults of] the people, and Allah loves the virtuous;
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna yunfiqūna fis sarrā-i waḍ ḍarrā-i wal kāẓimīnal ghayẓa wal `āfīna `anin nās ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbul muḥsinīn

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا فَعَلُوا۟ فَـٰحِشَةً أَوْ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ ذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَٱسْتَغْفَرُوا۟ لِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَمَن يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ وَلَمْ يُصِرُّوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: and those who, when they commit an indecent act or wrong themselves, remember Allah, and plead [to Allah seeking His] forgiveness for their sins—and who forgives sins except Allah?—and who knowingly do not persist in what [sins] they have committed.
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna idhā fa`alū fāḥishatan aw ẓalamū anfusahum dhakarullāha fastaghfarū lidhunūbihim wa man yaghfirudh dhunūba illallāhu walam yuṣirrū `alā mā fa`alū wahum ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ جَزَآؤُهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَجَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَنِعْمَ أَجْرُ ٱلْعَـٰمِلِينَ
ayas.translation: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever]. How excellent is the reward of the workers!
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ika jazā-uhum maghfiratun min rabbihim wajannātun tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā ۚ wani`ma ajrul `āmilīn

ayas.arabic: قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ سُنَنٌ فَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
ayas.translation: Certain [Divine] precedents have passed before you. So travel through the land and observe how was the fate of the deniers.
ayas.transliteration: qad khalat min qablikum sunanun fasīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mukadhhibīn

ayas.arabic: هَـٰذَا بَيَانٌ لِّلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَمَوْعِظَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
ayas.translation: This is an explanation for mankind, and a guidance and advice for the Godwary.
ayas.transliteration: hādhā bayānul linnāsi wahudan wa maw`iẓatun lil-muttaqīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: Do not weaken or grieve: you shall have the upper hand, should you be faithful.
ayas.transliteration: walā tahinū walā taḥzanū wa-antumul-a`lawna in kuntum mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: إِن يَمْسَسْكُمْ قَرْحٌ فَقَدْ مَسَّ ٱلْقَوْمَ قَرْحٌ مِّثْلُهُۥ ۚ وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَيَّامُ نُدَاوِلُهَا بَيْنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَيَتَّخِذَ مِنكُمْ شُهَدَآءَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: If wounds afflict you, like wounds have already afflicted those people; and We make such vicissitudes rotate among mankind, so that Allah may ascertain those who have faith, and that He may take martyrs from among you, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
ayas.transliteration: in yamsaskum qarḥun faqad massal qawma qarḥun mithluh ۚ watilkal-ayyāmu nudāwiluhā baynan nāsi waliya`lamallāhul ladhīna āmanū wayattakhidha minkum shuhadā-a ۗ wallāhu lā yuḥibbuẓ ẓālimīn

ayas.arabic: وَلِيُمَحِّصَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَيَمْحَقَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: And so that Allah may purge [the hearts of] those who have faith and that He may wipe out the faithless.
ayas.transliteration: waliyumaḥḥiṣallāhul ladhīna āmanū wayamḥaqal kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَن تَدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَمَّا يَعْلَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ مِنكُمْ وَيَعْلَمَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Do you suppose that you would enter paradise, while Allah has not yet ascertained those of you who have waged jihad and He has not ascertained the steadfast?
ayas.transliteration: am ḥasibtum an tadkhulul jannata walammā ya`lamillāhul ladhīna jāhadū minkum waya`lamaṣ ṣābirīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كُنتُمْ تَمَنَّوْنَ ٱلْمَوْتَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَلْقَوْهُ فَقَدْ رَأَيْتُمُوهُ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Certainly you were longing for death before you had encountered it. Then certainly, you saw it, as you were looking on.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad kuntum tamannawnal mawta min qabli an talqawhu faqad ra-aytumūhu wa-antum tanẓurūn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا مُحَمَّدٌ إِلَّا رَسُولٌ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِ ٱلرُّسُلُ ۚ أَفَإِي۟ن مَّاتَ أَوْ قُتِلَ ٱنقَلَبْتُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَنقَلِبْ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ فَلَن يَضُرَّ ٱللَّهَ شَيْـًٔا ۗ وَسَيَجْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Muhammad is but an apostle; [other] apostles have passed before him. If he dies or is slain, will you turn back on your heels? Anyone who turns back on his heels, will not harm Allah in the least, and soon Allah will reward the grateful.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā muḥammadun illā rasūlun qad khalat min qablihir rusul ۚ afa-in māta aw qutilan-qalabtum `alā a`qābikum ۚ wa man yanqalib `alā `aqibayhi falan yaḍurrallāha shay-ā ۗ wasayajzillāhush shākirīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفْسٍ أَن تَمُوتَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ كِتَـٰبًا مُّؤَجَّلًا ۗ وَمَن يُرِدْ ثَوَابَ ٱلدُّنْيَا نُؤْتِهِۦ مِنْهَا وَمَن يُرِدْ ثَوَابَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ نُؤْتِهِۦ مِنْهَا ۚ وَسَنَجْزِى ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
ayas.translation: No soul may die except by Allah’s leave, at an appointed time. Whoever desires the reward of this world, We will give him of it; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter, We will give him of it; and soon We will reward the grateful.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā kāna linafsin an tamūta illā bi-idhnillāhi kitāban mu-ajjalā ۗ wa man yurid thawābad dunyā nu-tihi minhā wa man yurid thawābal-ākhirati nu-tihi minhā ۚ wasanajzish shākirīn

ayas.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن نَّبِىٍّ قَـٰتَلَ مَعَهُۥ رِبِّيُّونَ كَثِيرٌ فَمَا وَهَنُوا۟ لِمَآ أَصَابَهُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا ضَعُفُوا۟ وَمَا ٱسْتَكَانُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: How many a prophet there has been with whom a multitude of godly men fought. They did not falter for what befell them in the way of Allah, neither did they weaken, nor did they abase themselves; and Allah loves the steadfast.
ayas.transliteration: waka-ayyin min nabiyyin qātala ma`ahu ribbiyyūna kathīrun famā wahanū limā aṣābahum fī sabīlillāhi wa mā ḍa`ufū wa mas-takānū ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbuṣ ṣābirīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ قَوْلَهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِىٓ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: All that they said was, ‘Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our affairs, make our feet steady, and help us against the faithless lot.’
ayas.transliteration: wa mā kāna qawlahum illā an qālū rabbanagh-fir lanā dhunūbanā wa isrāfanā fī amrinā wathabbit aqdāmanā wanṣurnā `alal-qawmil kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: فَـَٔاتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ثَوَابَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَحُسْنَ ثَوَابِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
ayas.translation: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the fair reward of the Hereafter; and Allah loves the virtuous.
ayas.transliteration: fa-ātāhumullāhu thawābad dunyā waḥusna thawābil-ākhirah ۗ wallāhu yuḥibbul muḥsinīn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تُطِيعُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَرُدُّوكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ فَتَنقَلِبُوا۟ خَـٰسِرِينَ
ayas.translation: O you who have faith! If you obey the faithless, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will become losers.
ayas.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū in tuṭī`ul ladhīna kafarū yaruddūkum `alā a`qābikum fatanqalibū khāsirīn

ayas.arabic: بَلِ ٱللَّهُ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلنَّـٰصِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed, Allah is your Master, and He is the best of helpers.
ayas.transliteration: balillāhu mawlākum ۖ wahuwa khayrun nāṣirīn

ayas.arabic: سَنُلْقِى فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلرُّعْبَ بِمَآ أَشْرَكُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِۦ سُلْطَـٰنًا ۖ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ ۚ وَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: We shall cast terror into the hearts of the faithless because of their ascribing partners to Allah, for which He has not sent down any authority, and their refuge shall be the Fire, and evil is the [final] abode of the wrongdoers.
ayas.transliteration: sanulqī fī qulūbil ladhīna kafarur ru`ba bimā ashrakū billāhi mā lam yunazzil bihi sulṭānā ۖ wa ma-wāhumun nār ۚ wabi-sa mathwaẓ ẓālimīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَدَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَعْدَهُۥٓ إِذْ تَحُسُّونَهُم بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَشِلْتُمْ وَتَنَـٰزَعْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْرِ وَعَصَيْتُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَآ أَرَىٰكُم مَّا تُحِبُّونَ ۚ مِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ ثُمَّ صَرَفَكُمْ عَنْهُمْ لِيَبْتَلِيَكُمْ ۖ وَلَقَدْ عَفَا عَنكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: Allah certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were slaying them with His leave, until you lost courage, disputed about the matter, and disobeyed after He showed you what you loved. Some among you desire this world, and some among you desire the Hereafter. Then He turned you away from them so that He might test you. Certainly He has excused you, for Allah is gracious to the faithful.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad ṣadaqakumullāhu wa`dahu idh taḥussūnahum bi-idhnih ۖ ḥattā idhā fashiltum watanāza`tum fil-amri wa`aṣaytum min ba`di mā arākum mā tuḥibbūn ۚ minkum man yurīdud dunyā wa minkum man yurīdul-ākhirah ۚ thumma ṣarafakum `anhum liyabtaliyakum ۖ walaqad `afā `ankum ۗ wallāhu dhū faḍlin `alal-mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: إِذْ تُصْعِدُونَ وَلَا تَلْوُۥنَ عَلَىٰٓ أَحَدٍ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ فِىٓ أُخْرَىٰكُمْ فَأَثَـٰبَكُمْ غَمًّۢا بِغَمٍّ لِّكَيْلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا مَآ أَصَـٰبَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: When you were fleeing without paying any attention to anyone, while the Apostle was calling you from your rear, He requited you with grief upon grief, so that you may not grieve for what you lose nor for what befalls you, and Allah is well aware of what you do.
ayas.transliteration: idh tuṣ`idūna walā talwūna `alā aḥadin war rasūlu yad`ūkum fī ukhrākum fa-athābakum ghamman bighammin likaylā taḥzanū `alā mā fātakum walā mā aṣābakum ۗ wallāhu khabīrun bimā ta`malūn

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنزَلَ عَلَيْكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلْغَمِّ أَمَنَةً نُّعَاسًا يَغْشَىٰ طَآئِفَةً مِّنكُمْ ۖ وَطَآئِفَةٌ قَدْ أَهَمَّتْهُمْ أَنفُسُهُمْ يَظُنُّونَ بِٱللَّهِ غَيْرَ ٱلْحَقِّ ظَنَّ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِيَّةِ ۖ يَقُولُونَ هَل لَّنَا مِنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ مِن شَىْءٍ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْأَمْرَ كُلَّهُۥ لِلَّهِ ۗ يُخْفُونَ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِم مَّا لَا يُبْدُونَ لَكَ ۖ يَقُولُونَ لَوْ كَانَ لَنَا مِنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ شَىْءٌ مَّا قُتِلْنَا هَـٰهُنَا ۗ قُل لَّوْ كُنتُمْ فِى بُيُوتِكُمْ لَبَرَزَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُتِبَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَتْلُ إِلَىٰ مَضَاجِعِهِمْ ۖ وَلِيَبْتَلِىَ ٱللَّهُ مَا فِى صُدُورِكُمْ وَلِيُمَحِّصَ مَا فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
ayas.translation: Then He sent down to you safety after grief—a drowsiness that came over a group of you—while another group, anxious only about themselves, entertained false notions about Allah, notions of [pagan] ignorance. They say, ‘Do we have any role in the matter?’ Say, ‘Indeed the matter belongs totally to Allah.’ They hide in their hearts what they do not disclose to you. They say, ‘Had we any role in the matter, we would not have been slain here.’ Say, ‘Even if you had remained in your houses, those destined to be slain would have set out toward the places where they were laid to rest, so that Allah may test what is in your breasts, and that He may purge what is in your hearts, and Allah knows well what is in the breasts.’
